name: Japanese-style Shrimp and Broccolini Pasta
description: Japanese-style Shrimp and Broccolini Pasta is an easy recipe that everyone will love. Seasoned with crunchy garlic chili oil, dashi soy sauce, and butter, this wafu pasta dish is incredibly flavorful and satisfying. Ready in just 15 minutes!

video.description:
Seasoned with butter, dashi soy sauce, and garlic chili oil, this Japanese-style Pasta with Shrimp and Broccolini is an easy pasta dish everyone will love! It's incredibly flavorful and hearty. Ready in 15 minutes!

*This is a sponsored video and blog post created by me on behalf of Rakuten.*

‚òÖ PRODUCT LINKS ‚òÖ

S&B Chili Oil with Crunchy Garlic ‚ñ∂ https://www.rakuten.com/shop/jfoods/product/SB_CHILI_OIL_WITH_CRUNCHY_GARLIC/?scid=pr_joc

Kamada Soy Sauce Dashi Shoyu ‚ñ∂ https://www.rakuten.com/shop/jfoods/product/KAMADA_DASHI_SHOYU/?scid=pr_joc

Maeda-en Genmai Brown Rice Tea ‚ñ∂ https://www.rakuten.com/shop/jfoods/product/MAEDA-EN_GENMAI-BROWN_RICE_TEA/?scid=pr_joc

RECIPE starts ‚ñ∂ 01:16

PRINT RECIPE ‚ñ∂ https://bit.ly/JapanesePastaWithShrimpBroccolini

INGREDIENTS (Please check the website for detailed info)

1 Tbsp kosher/sea salt (use half for table salt) (for boiling pasta)
7 oz spaghetti (200 g)
3.5 oz broccolini (100 g; or asparagus or similar vegetables)
1 clove garlic
1 Tbsp extra virgin olive oil
10 shrimp (145 g, 5 oz; shelled and deveined)
kosher/sea salt (use half for table salt)
freshly ground black pepper
1 Tbsp unsalted butter
1-1 ¬Ω Tbsp chili oil with crunchy garlic (Adjust to your spicy level; I used S&B Chili Oil with Crunchy Garlic)
2 Tbsp dashi soy sauce (I used Kamada Soy Sauce Dashi Shoyu)

INSTRUCTIONS with step-by-step pics ‚ñ∂ https://bit.ly/JapanesePastaWithShrimpBroccolini

How to Make Japanese Pasta with Shrimp and Broccolini (Recipe) Êµ∑ËÄÅ„Å®„Éñ„É≠„ÉÉ„Ç≥„É™„Éº„Éã„ÅÆÂíåÈ¢®„Éë„Çπ„Çø„ÅÆ‰Ωú„ÇäÊñπ („É¨„Ç∑„Éî)

recipeIngredient: 1 Tbsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt ((for boiling the pasta))
3.5 oz broccolini ((or asparagus or similar vegetables))
1‚Äì1¬Ω Tbsp chili oil with crunchy garlic

itemListElement.text: Start boiling 4 quarts (16 cups, 3.8 L) water in a large pot (I used a 4.5 QT Dutch oven). Once boiling, add 1 Tbsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt and 7 oz spaghetti.
itemListElement.name: Start boiling 4 quarts (16 cups, 3.8 L) water in a large pot (I used a 4.5 QT Dutch oven). Once boiling, add 1 Tbsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt and 7 oz spaghetti.

itemListElement.text: Stir to make sure the spaghetti doesn‚Äôt stick to each other. Tip: I usually reduce the cooking time by 1 minute if I will continue cooking the pasta in the sauce. Drain if you finish boiling the spaghetti first, but you should be able to cook the rest of the ingredients in 10 minutes while the pasta is boiling.
itemListElement.name: Stir to make sure the spaghetti doesn‚Äôt stick to each other. Tip: I usually reduce the cooking time by 1 minute if I will continue cooking the pasta in the sauce. Drain if you finish boiling the spaghetti first, but you should be able to cook the rest of the ingredients in 10 minutes while the pasta is boiling.

itemListElement.text: While boiling the pasta, prepare the ingredients. Cut and discard the ends of 3.5 oz broccolini and cut the stalks in half or 2-inch pieces.
itemListElement.name: While boiling the pasta, prepare the ingredients. Cut and discard the ends of 3.5 oz broccolini and cut the stalks in half or 2-inch pieces.

itemListElement.text: Peel 1 clove garlic and thinly slice it.
itemListElement.name: Peel 1 clove garlic and thinly slice it.

recipeInstructions.name: To Cook the Ingredients and Pasta

itemListElement.text: Heat 1 Tbsp extra virgin olive oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Once the pan is warm, add 10 shrimp.
itemListElement.name: Heat 1 Tbsp extra virgin olive oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Once the pan is warm, add 10 shrimp.

itemListElement.text: Season the shrimp with Diamond Crystal kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper.
itemListElement.name: Season the shrimp with Diamond Crystal kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper.

itemListElement.text: Fry both sides of the shrimp until they are almost cooked through. Then, transfer them to a plate.
itemListElement.name: Fry both sides of the shrimp until they are almost cooked through. Then, transfer them to a plate.

itemListElement.text: In the same frying pan over medium heat, add the sliced garlic and 1 Tbsp unsalted butter.
itemListElement.name: In the same frying pan over medium heat, add the sliced garlic and 1 Tbsp unsalted butter.

itemListElement.text: While the butter is melting, add the broccolini.
itemListElement.name: While the butter is melting, add the broccolini.

itemListElement.text: Season the broccolini with Diamond Crystal kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper.
itemListElement.name: Season the broccolini with Diamond Crystal kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper.

itemListElement.text: Stir and cook until the broccolini stems are tender. Add the shrimp back into the pan.
itemListElement.name: Stir and cook until the broccolini stems are tender. Add the shrimp back into the pan.

itemListElement.text: Add 1‚Äì1¬Ω Tbsp chili oil with crunchy garlic.
itemListElement.name: Add 1‚Äì1¬Ω Tbsp chili oil with crunchy garlic.

itemListElement.text: Stir and toss the ingredients to coat with the seasoning. Add the boiled spaghetti to the pan (I use a pair of tongs to pick up the spaghetti from the pot and add it directly).
itemListElement.name: Stir and toss the ingredients to coat with the seasoning. Add the boiled spaghetti to the pan (I use a pair of tongs to pick up the spaghetti from the pot and add it directly).

itemListElement.text: Mix the spaghetti and ingredients well to combine.
itemListElement.name: Mix the spaghetti and ingredients well to combine.

itemListElement.text: Lastly, add 2 Tbsp dashi soy sauce and mix it all together.
itemListElement.name: Lastly, add 2 Tbsp dashi soy sauce and mix it all together.

itemListElement.text: Divide the pasta into individual plates. Enjoy!
itemListElement.name: Divide the pasta into individual plates. Enjoy!

review.reviewBody: This is absolutely delicious, and a breeze to make!  I love that hint of dashi in the dish.  This is pretty light and is a perfect meal for a busy day.
I‚Äôve tried this recipe several times, I omitted the chilli oil but it still tastes as great! I added shredded dried seaweed as a topping before serving. My family would ask for this every week üòä

so easy and delicious! with only a few ingredients this dish had so much flavor. I used the 1/4 tsp dashi powder mixed with water, soy sauce as recommended and turned out great. Will definitely make again

I made this recipe before and LOVED it, so did my very picky boyfriend. Ever since I got pregnant, shrimp has been an aversion for me so I'm going to make it with Aburaage this week instead! 10/10 recipe, I make it for dinner about once a month now.

Very fast and delicious, very little chopping which is what takes long prep on stir fries. I doubled the recipe, added some mirin while broccolini was cooking (husband likes it a little more cooked). Used Chow Mein noodles since that was what I had. It was great. Next time I will add a little more garlic and a little more chili/garlic sauce - great weeknight meal.
Very simple and delicious! I used fettuccine because I didn‚Äôt have any spaghetti, and I found I needed a bit more sauce. My son didn‚Äôt want to eat his Mac n cheese and stole my noodles instead.
